Class MathUtils

java.lang.Object
ch.juventus.javadoc.MathUtils
public class MathUtils extends Object
The MathUtils class implements methods to add, subtract, divide and multiply numbers.

  • Constructor Summary

    This method divides the first number by the second and returns the result.
    double

    This method multiplies the first number by the second and returns the result.
    double
    subtraction(double a, double b)

  • Constructor Details

    • MathUtils

      public MathUtils()

  • Method Details

    • addition

      public double addition(List<Double> numbers)
      This method adds all the given numbers to a total. If the input list is empty, 0 will be returned. If the input list is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
      Parameters:
      numbers - The list of numbers to add together
      Returns:
      The sum of all the given numbers
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - Thrown if the input list is null

    • subtraction

      public double subtraction(double a, double b)
      This method subtracts the second number from the first and returns the result. Params can not be null.
      Parameters:
      a - The number to subtract from
      b - The number to subtract
      Returns:
      The result of the subtraction

    • division

      public double division(double a, double b)
      This method divides the first number by the second and returns the result. Params can not be null.
      Parameters:
      a - The number to divide
      b - The number to divide by
      Returns:
      The result of the division

    • multiplication

      public double multiplication(double a, double b)
      This method multiplies the first number by the second and returns the result. Params can not be null.
      Parameters:
      a - The number to multiply
      b - The number to multiply by
      Returns:
      The result of the multiplication
